intro: Glochidion zeylanicum var. paucicarpum, commonly known as the small-fruited glabrous woodbine, is a shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually glabrous. The plant produces small, clustered flowers followed by capsule fruits that contain few seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and local flora.
